text:
On both 2.0.43 and 2.0.44 I have the following problem.  An SSL-only server,
listening on 443, receives a request something like the following:

https://site.usp.org/dir/

The server replies with the following:

HTTP/1.1 302 
Date: Thu, 20 Mar 2003 16:03:32 GMT
Server: Apache/2.0
Location: http://site.usp.org:443/dir/index.html
Content-Type: text/html;charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Language: en
Transfer-Encoding: chunked

This will fail because the server is a) only listening on 443 and b) is
expecting SSL traffic there, not unencrypted requests.

I'm assuming this is a problem with mod_dir, but that's just a guess.
creator: jsp@usp.org

text:
Nothing in Apache's default configuration will cause a redirect to
"index.html", so there must be something special going on in your
configuration.  The only redirect that mod_dir uses is to add a
trailing slash to directory requests.  So this problem is almost
surely a configuration error on your part.

If you can replicate this with the default apache config, or you can
identify the specific changes made to a default config that generate
this problem, please feel free to reopen this bug.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
